metadata.title: CVE-2013-4339 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 3.6.1 does not properly validate URLs before use in anHTTP redirect, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended redirectionrestrictions via a crafted string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 3.6.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.1+dfsg-1').
